title: Daily reminder that Fears are the only hard CC that don't lower Scuttle Crab's Resistances

replies.body: Hecarim has bigger problems if he's Ulting the Scuttler.

Given that Fiddlesticks is literally the worst champion to try and take Scuttler with, he definitely needs this.
i wonder who's the easiest champion to take scuttler with?

{{champion:14}}
Hands down, no contest, bar none.  Enemy coming?  Send it packing with a big scary roar.  

ROAR.  SMASH.  BOOM.  It's that easy.  

By the way, here's a first world problems problem.  My {{champion:67}} starts attacking the scuttler and scares it INTO the enemy team.  You guys know that it runs away from you right?  So why would you push it into their {{champion:64}}?  Just because he's blind doesn't mean he isn't going to steal it and give his team a huge advantage in this Dragon contest we're about to see.  Instead, how about you just wait one second and let me body-block roar that son-of-a-bitch right into that there wall?  Yeah, that wall closest to us and farthest from them.  How about that?

Probably Nidalee due to the snare and burst damage.  Though Mundo does it pretty well, even if he can't lower its resistances.

Anyone with high attack speed and the Krug's buff does it very easily as well.
Ashe. Keeps it slowed, massive autos. Plus crits.

I think Nautilus is one of the easier champs to take Scuttler with. He can deal solid enough damage with his W's DoT to efficiently kill the crab, and has enough CC to lock it down too.

It's not the fastest, but he's really easy to do it with.
Have you ever tried to take the crab with singed?

I think I have. Singed is the closest competition (if I may call it that) to Fiddlesticks in terms of being horrible at taking Scuttler, and in my opinion, Fiddlesticks is much harder to take the Scuttler with, and it isn't even close.

What Fiddlesticks has to do to take it is either:

1. Drain it to death. He has to stand still to channel Drain, and the Scuttler runs away from him. After the Scuttle Crab leaves Fiddlestick's Drain range, Fiddlesticks has to chase after it, likely halfway across the river. And Fiddlesticks cannot kill the Scuttle Crab in one Drain channel, at least in the early game.

2. Dark Wind/Auto attack  to death. This also is a bad option because Fiddlesticks doesn't build attack damage, and Dark Wind also isn't enough to kill the Scuttle Crab in a couple hits either.

Singed at least can run around with poison active and auto attacking it to kill it at least somewhat effectively, but Fiddlesticks taking the Crab is completely ineffective.
Singed has his Fling to lower it's resistances, so he can at least autoattack it to death in a semi-timely manner.
If you do it right you can get it so you can run in a circle with it while it walks in your poison cloud.

1. Scuttle crab's defenses are lowered using displacements.
2. How do you define Hard CC? Some people define it as anything that can stop channels. Some define it as lose of movement. Some define it as no movement.

Edit: The fact that a debate exist in the section below is why I asked the 2nd question lol.

> [{quoted}](name=GuiltyGecko,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YEj1posT,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-05-01T03:54:30.011+0000)
>
> 1. Scuttle crab's defenses are lowered using displacements.
> 2. How do you define Hard CC? Some people define it as anything that can stop channels. Some define it as lose of movement. Some define it as no movement.

Hard CC is anything that stops channels aka anything that directly impairs your movement. The term predates League by several years. Fears/Silences/Stuns/Charms/Roots/Taunts/Entangled are all Hard CC. All of these hard CCs reduce his resistances and technically Fear impairs movement.

Soft CCs are Slows/Blinds since neither remove your ability to move.
